etymologies: 1940s; earliest use found in Moshé Feldenkrais (1904–1984). From Japanese jūdōgi (not dated in dictionaries of Japanese) from jūdō + -gi, combining form of ki clothing, nominalized stem of kiru to put on (clothes), to wear

definitions: The uniform worn in judo, traditionally white, and comprising a heavy jacket, lightweight trousers, and a belt.
